    • Method Detail

      • benchMark

        public static void benchMark(int size,
                             int threads,
                             int timer)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                             java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Makes the AI play against itself 100 times and reports results. No game data is shared between any of the AI instances so the games don't have effect on each other.

        The amount of threads should not exceed the amount of available CPU cores as this would reduce the amount of simulation each state of the game gets.

        Parameters:
        size - the size of the game
        threads - how many games are being played simultaneously
        timer - how long the AI is allowed to simulate the game per turn
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - concurrency exception
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - concurrency exception

      • trainAI

        public static void trainAI(AIPlayer ai,
                           GameState startState,
                           long timer)
        Trains the given AI from the given gamestate for the duration of the timer. Usually called by the AI itself.
        Parameters:
        ai - the ai instance being trained
        startState - the gamestate where all simulations start from
        timer - the amount of time allowed for training

      • play

        public static void play(int size,
                        Player first,
                        Player second)
        Plays a game of given size.
        Parameters:
        size - size of the game
        first - player going first
        second - player going second
